page.title: 14Worksop Bypass
page.content: The construction of the road is costing a large amount of money as in addition to the normal costs is the price of roundabouts, undercuttings and footbridges which will allow life for locals to continue more or less as normal. There was initial concern from people living by the route over noise, fumes and the value of property. The initial order was made by the Minister of Transport in 1979 to construct 8.18km (5.09 miles) of highway. To allow work to be done on private roads he needed an order under Section 14 of the 1980 Highways Act. Leaflets were sent to people living beside the proposed route to inform them of the new plans. A model was also put on display and drawings and documents were available to the public. The public were also informed of how to voice any objections.
